meanings.definition: The quality or state of being preachy.
meanings.sent1: Her constant preachinesses about healthy eating became tiresome to her friends.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't stand the preachinesses of the speaker at the seminar.
meanings.sent3: The preachinesses of the health guru made everyone roll their eyes.
meanings.sent4: The preachinesses of the teacher were like a never-ending lecture.
meanings.sent5: The preachinesses of the politician were as annoying as a broken record.

meanings.definition: The act of delivering a sermon or religious message in a moralistic or self-righteous manner.
meanings.sent1: The preacher's preachinesses during the service made some congregants uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: His preachinesses were evident in every word he spoke from the pulpit.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meows had a hint of preachinesses, as if she was giving a sermon.
meanings.sent4: The preachinesses of the radio host were like a religious broadcast.
meanings.sent5: The preachinesses of the boss were as imposing as a church bell tolling.
